bibl.title: Letter from Alexander N. Stark to Robert P. Cooke, July 24, 1900

div1.p: Stark reprimands Cooke for his handling of a yellow fever outbreak at Pinar del Rio.

div1.head: Letter from Alexander N. Stark to Robert P. Cooke, July 24, 1900
div1.opener:
L.S. 206, Military ile, 1900.
CHIEF SURGEON'S OFFICE,
Hdqrs. Dept. Havana & Pinar del Rio
QUEMADOS, CUBA.
July 24th, 1900.
FROM GEN. J. R. KEAN
Act. Asst. Surgeon, Robt. P. Cooke, U.S. Army,
Pinar del Rio Barracks, Cuba.
(Thro' Military Channels)
Sir:-
div1.p:
Being temporarily in charge of the Chief Surgeon's
Office, I shall simply reprimand you for the course you have pursued in
the face of an epidemic of Yellow Fever, that should have been apparent.

Lack of experience cannot be advanced as an excuse--at these
Headquarters, on reporting, you were warned to be observant of conditions

Your short experience in the Military service has not tended
to excite confidence in your superiors that your future services will
be satisfactory.

For the present you will remain at Pinar del Rio Barracks,
holding yourself in readiness to comply with such instructions as will
be forwarde in due course of time.

Let this awful experience be a lesson to you and do not again
run counter to advice founded upon experience in such matters.

While you are not as culpable as your associates, do not
flatter yourself that the authorities will hold you guiltless.
div1.closer:
A. N. Stark,
Captain & Asst. Surgeon, U.S. Army,
Acting Chief Surgeon.
